steps.title: Launch site & reach dashboard
details: User lands on https://invoify.vercel.app/en and sees dashboard.

steps.title: Header branding check
details: Invoify logo visible in header, confirming brand presence.

steps.title: Enter sender name
details: Name appears in Live Preview as expected.

steps.title: Add custom field to Bill-From
details: Live Preview never shows the new value → expectation broken.

steps.title: Delete custom field
details: Field disappears from form and DOM.

steps.title: Tab states & navigation
details: Initial check that ‘From & To’ tab renders as selected (black bg) FAILS – element or style not found.
Later, ‘Next’ button successfully opens ‘Invoice Details’ tab and title is visible.

steps.title: Invoice logo upload
details: User cannot click/locate ‘Invoice Details’ tab in one run; in another run upload itself fails with 429/quota error.
As a result, logo never appears and subsequent verification steps are skipped.

steps.title: Issue Date selection
details: User picks 1 Oct 2025; field shows the date but Live Preview DOES NOT update, so verification times out.

emotional_arc: Starts confident (site loads, logo visible). Satisfaction grows as name & address mirror immediately in preview. Confidence dips when custom field fails to show—first sign of mismatch. Relief when deletion works. Frustration returns with unclear active-tab styling, then spikes during repeated logo-upload failures and missing date in preview. Journey ends in disappointment and doubt about reliability.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Live Preview synchronisation (custom fields, dates, logo)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: When input changes aren’t reflected instantly, users question whether information is saved, creating distrust.
next_actions: Audit all form fields & custom inputs to ensure they trigger preview re-render.
Add optimistic UI cue (spinner or subtle pulse) while preview is updating.
Write unit tests for each field → preview mapping to prevent regressions.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Clear indication of the current step keeps multi-step forms usable; missing/incorrect CSS or ARIA labels confuses users & breaks automated tests.
next_actions: Ensure selected tab gets persistent ‘bg-primary text-foreground’ classes.
Standardise button labels (remove extra spaces/periods) and add aria-current attributes.
Add keyboard focus outline for WCAG compliance.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Uploading a logo is a key branding step. Silent failure or 429 errors leave users stuck with no guidance.
next_actions: Throttle backend/API calls to prevent rate limits, or surface a helpful error toast.
Provide progress bar & success state (show thumbnail) after upload.
Make ‘Remove logo’ button visible only after successful upload, hide otherwise.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Custom fields differentiate invoices; if the value doesn’t display, user may assume feature is broken.
next_actions: Bind custom field data to preview renderer like core fields.
Auto-scroll preview to new content so user sees success instantly.
Persist custom fields in saved invoice template.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Performance feedback on slow actions (e.g., 300-second typing lag)
next_actions: Investigate long run-times; likely unnecessary waits in JS. Debounce expensive effects.
Show inline loader if operation >500 ms.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Flaky selectors (‘1  .  From & To’) indicate hidden characters; hurts both tests and screen-reader users.
next_actions: Trim label text, avoid double spaces & stray punctuation.
Add data-testids for stable automation hooks.

first_tackles.description: Fix Live Preview binding for custom inputs & Issue Date – fastest code change, biggest confidence gain.
Clamp & communicate file-upload errors; show logo thumbnail or clear failure message.
Harden active-tab styling/aria-current so the current step is unmistakable.
Clean up label text & add data-testids to eliminate flaky selectors and improve accessibility.
Add micro-loading indicators for any action that may exceed 1 s (preview render, upload).
